job_title: Highly Unethical and Suffocating Work Environment in London, England
pros:
Good team to work with 
Good colleges and stakeholders in the CCCG Group.
cons:
I have been a victim of bullying at CCCG (CONEL Business Department) . I have raised my voice via the union and HR but still the person got away with openly name calling and picking on me repetitively. 

No freedom to apply for annual leave  holidays i.e. Conditional holidays only allowed for me while other staff members were told to take breaks.


Constantly being bullied and forced to come on site when COVID-19 was on its peak as I had extenuating circumstances. Even after agreeing to work on site and from home I was constantly bullied to come on site full time. 

False accusations made by the management 

Breach of contract

Controlling and gossiping

pros: Flexible work and reasonable workloads
cons: Very low salaries compared to other educational institutions

review_title: Do not work at this organisation
pros: 1. Some members of the workforce are friendly and easy to get on with.
cons:
1. HR, Payroll and Finance are incompetent at doing their jobs properly. They refuse to response to emails properly and answer the question you have for them. You literally have to chase them to sort out anything. There is no team work going on and no understanding and thought processing going on in any of their work. 
2. Senior management fail to understand to work that gets done by the workers underneath them. There are a lot of orders being dished out but no understanding of how challenging some work tasks can be. 
3. The workplace does not care about their workers at all! No understanding of work-life balance, mental health and wellbeing. The workforce are not robots! 
4. The food for staff and students is overpriced and bland. 
5. The purse strings are tightly closed. There is never any additional money to support staff and students projects, which is a shame. 
6. The toilets needs refurbishing. The toilets become blocked very quickly. The poor drainage system makes a terrible smell arise daily.

review_title: Overrun by poor management, lacking talent or inspiration and zero progression
pros:
- Flexible working pattern
- Manageable workloads
cons:
- Extremely low employee morale
- Lack of staffing due to budgeting
- Very low talent pool among members of staff.
- No career progression or chance to grow and development
- Management do not listen to staff, or their concerns. They do things their way.
- Managers are not inspiring, innovative or forward thinkers.
- Job not secure unless you're management, college is happy to just dismiss staff to satisfy their budget regardless of the work you do.
